newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Kingboard raises loan to HK$180mln.
newsitem.headline: Kingboard raises loan to HK$180mln.

text.p: Kingboard Chemical Holdings' loan facility has been increased to HK$180 million from HK$150 million, arranger ABN Amro Bank said.
At one stage, the facility was increased to HK$240 million due to oversubsciptions during the syndication stage, but the borrower decided to scale back the loan size to HK$180 million.
The facility is jointly and severally guaranteed by Kingboard Laminates Ltd and its wholly-owned subsidiary Jamplan China Group.
American Express Bank and Standard Chartered Bank joined the arranger group. The deal has been fully underwritten.
The facility has two tranches, both with a final maturity of three years.
Tranche A is a HK$100 million term loan.
It will be repaid by five equal semi-annual instalments after a grace period of 12 months from loan signing date.
Tranche B is HK$50 million revolving credit. Repayment is in bullet. The interest margin is 135 basis points over the Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate.
Fees are 50 basis points for lead managers committing HK$21-25 million, and 40 basis points for managers committing HK$15-20 million.
Proceeds are for general working capital and capital expenditure requirements.
Arranger ABN Amro takes HK$16.8 million.
Co-arrangers with HK$16.8 million each are American Express Bank, Citibank and Standard Chartered Bank.
Lead managers with HK$16.2 million are Bayerische Vereinsbank Hong Kong, Emirates Bank International Hong Kong, and LTCB Japan.

Managers with HK$14.1 million each are Banque Worms Hong Kong, and Kredietbank. Other managers with HK$12 million each are Banque Nationale de Paris Hong Kong, Sumitomo Bank and Thai Farmers Bank Hong Kong.
